params._tokenAddress: Address of payment token (address(0) for native crypto) owner in this case is the FlywheelCampaigns contract that will never change

returns._0: Current balance in payment token or native crypto

sendPayment(uint256,address).details: Can only be called by the owner (FlywheelCampaigns contract)

withdrawAccidentalTokens(address,address.details: Can only be called by parent contract

params._to: Address to send the tokens to
params._token: Address of token to withdraw (or address(0) for native crypto)

campaignId().notice: Unique identifier of the campaign this contract manages

getBalance().notice: Gets the current balance of the campaign

parentAddress().notice: Address of the FlywheelCampaigns contract that created this instance

tokenAddress().notice: Address of the payment token (address(0) for native crypto)

withdrawAccidentalTokens(address,address.notice: Withdraws accidentally sent tokens that aren't the campaign's payment token

documentation.text: @notice Address of the FlywheelCampaigns contract that created this instance
@notice Unique identifier of the campaign this contract manages
@notice Address of the payment token (address(0) for native crypto)

@notice Gets the current balance of the campaign
 @return Current balance in payment token or native crypto

@notice Fallback function to receive native crypto
 @dev This is the fallback function for receiving ETH payments in case someone accidentally adds calldata to the transaction

@notice Receive function to accept native crypto payments
 @dev This is the standard way to receive ETH payments for CampaignBalance

@notice Manages balance and payments for individual advertising campaigns
 @dev Handles both native crypto and ERC20 token payments
